review_1: Its not really puzzle bobble, but it's kinda close. Fun distraction with cute graphics.
review_2: The art design, music, levels, etc, all stunning. Great work there. It's a joy to experience. But the controls are awful. Incredibly twitchy. And there's no sensitivity adjustment. So you spend a lot of time wrestling with what feels like millimetre precision to aim the ball... While the cluster of balls is slowly moving. With a projectile arc that falls off way too soon. So it ends up like a really tedious, twitchy, archery game with poor tracking. Then as your clump gets closer and closer to the vortex, the little guy starts throwing you super unhelpful colours. It's frustrating, because it comes so close. A sensitivity dial and less arced projectile curve could probably save this.
